script.Text: Can you tell me what happened?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: What do you remember?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: I was asleep when it happened, something woke me up, but I wasn’t really sure what it was.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I looked at the clock, and it was around 2am.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I remember hearing rustling in my apartment.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I was very awake, but I was still telling myself that it was just the rain.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: Suddenly, I heard a knock on my wall.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: Startled, I realized that someone or something was in my apartment.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I jumped out of bed, and quickly scanned the room for something that I could use to defend myself.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I grabbed my cricket bat lying next to the door, crept out of my room, hoping that it was just my roomate coming home late.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I walked into the room and saw a the burglar at my TV.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: As soon as the burglar saw me, he sprinted to the door.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: Unsure if he was actually leaving, I followed him to the door, but much to my relief, he was gone.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I am going to make a few quick adjustments to replicate the behavior of the environment you were describing.
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: Watson it was raining out.
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: You used "he" when talking about the burglar, were you able to determine the gender of the burglar?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: It was really dark in that room, but I was able to make out a little bit.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I’m pretty sure he was a man, no he was definitely a man.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: If he hadn’t run off, I would have given him a good smack, so he’d be easy to find.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: Was it as dark as it was in here?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: It was a little darker.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: Watson make it darker.
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: Can you describe anything else you were able to see of the burglar?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: Yeah it was pretty late, so none of the apartment lights were on.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I was still able to see some of the burglar, He was a man in all dark clothing, maybe 5 foot 10.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: It was hard to make out any facial features.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: He had a hoodie on like a punk.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: It seems like you remember a lot of physical detail for such a dark room, again are you sure you remember that much detail?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: Actually, now that I think about it, there was one light on in the room.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: We had christmas lights bordering our window, and we left them on that night.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: They were on the far end of the room, so they didn’t help me see the burglar’s face, but I was able to see his outline pretty clearly.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: He was looking right at me too, if only I had a light.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I would have been able to see everything.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: You mentioned the burglar was looking at  your TV.
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: What thoughts came to your mind when you saw the burglar doing this?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: I remember feeling angry at this point.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I don’t know what else he had in his bag and didn’t want to lose anything else.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: He saw me with my bat at this point and started to flea.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I started to follow him with my bat in hand.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I should’ve took him out right there!
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: He had a bag?
script.Speaker: I

script.Text: Yes... he had a backpack, I presume this is what he used to hold all the other things he took.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: You know who has a backpack?
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: My slimy neighbor Steve.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: He came over to hangout with my girlfriend last week and was commenting on how nice my TV was.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: I bet it was him.
script.Speaker: W

script.Text: Okay,  let’s take a small break.
script.Speaker: I
